page.title: 05ECOLOGY 1:BED'HM:HED'HM
page.content: The area is covered with ice-age dep- osits,mostly boulder-clay,but with a belt of sands & gravels extending more or less E/W across the N. of Bedingham & middle of Hedenham.The gravel extraction sites in Bedingham,at Fox Burrows have filled with water & give fishing for a private club & a haven for wildlife,eg.Great Crested Grebes. In Hedenham a deposit of brickearth has been utilised in the past;& many of the older houses are built of Hedenham brick. The boulder-clay supports a character- istic meadow flora,where it is allowed to do so.On the verges & in the churchyards it is possible to find pyramidal orchids,cream-clover,burnet saxifrage,scabious,spiky restharrow & cowslips:consequently Bedingham & Hedenham churchyards have conservation areas to enable this flora to survive.
